comments.commentBody: About time.  It's a start.  Bases all over the world and two wars -- also much to trim back there.  Don't we know that the days of big militaries are over and that invading another country is expensive and creates more enemies than it defeats (if it defeats any)?

First of all I am a little confused as to where you live. You talk as if you live in New York but identified as living in Miami. I am going to answer as if you are sincere and was telling the truth about your identity.

First of all I am not for deporting all illegal immigrants. One of the other responses to my initial post assumed I was concerned about Hispanics and their influence. I lived for six years as a young child in El Paso and loved the society there. When my family moved back to Tenneessee I thought it was boring.

My main problem with the discussions is that the cost of comprehensive immigration reform is not discussed.

Great to hear. We should spend on what we need, not on a Command Post with no troops to command or an corporate welfare for Soviet Era weapons systems.  This will light up the lobbyists for the Defense Industry.
It's about time.

#5 When a person comments that many politicians are corrupt or incompetent I'm inclined to believe them and continue reading.  However, when someone comments that one specific party  is corrupt etc. I tend to think it is a political statement rather than a well thought argument for a particular point of view.
Instead of focusing on elections one and two years down the line, why don't politicians focus on solving our serious problems, then maybe people will have a reason to vote for them.

But the ranking Republican on the committee, Representative Howard P. McKeon of California, said, he was unconvinced “that these savings will be reinvested into America’s defense requirements and not harvested by Congressional Democrats for new domestic spending and entitlement programs.”

And the bloated Pentagon bureaucracy is not a domestic spending and entitlement program? If I have to choose between the Republican entitlement program, which involves killing people, and a Democratic entitlement program, whether in education, healthcare, or food stamps, I'll pick the Democratic program any day!

The debate on Immigration reform should give us pause. Socratic pause. By refusing to give answers; by asking and questioning the foundations of one's beleifs. I don't want answers as much as questions. Ceaslessly, the one's that reveal how problematic it is to send someone back across a border against their will, to deny one a degree that they have paid for, and that we knowingly lay claim to stolen land without the desire for redemption (predicated upon opening one's borders to those originally displaced). At some point we should not call it a crime to cross a border without feeling the utmost hypocricy and shame.

So the challenge will continue to be: managing the influx of immigrants and stablizing the countries from which they are fleeing: embracing democracy and the welfare systems that inevitably proceed from such governments. We will have to reign in Capitalism and the wars that are precipitated in their name. We must become historically honest and politically mature to deal the immigration problem. For now lets just consider the questions and in doing so create policy that does justice to them.
But I like having an empire.  It makes me feel manly.

In the spring of 2002, the New York legislature drew congressional districts to benefit the incumbents of each party since the legislature was split (Senate-R, Assembly-D). There were 12 Republicans in the House delegation in the spring of 2002. Four elections later, there are TWO. Even using the most powerful redistricting software , the voters overcame partisan districts and threw most of the Republicans out.

Well, murder is a civil violation as evidenced by the OJ Simpson trial.  The crime can be just as (or more) horriffic as a criminal vilation. Really, what does it matter - it's still illegal.  And wrong.  Very wrong.

One of the best comments of 2010 came from a Democratic Party operative who suggested a Democratic Party slogan for the Fall elections:

"WE MAY BE INCOMPETENT BUT THEY ARE CRAZY"

Poor Virginia will take a big hit.  Virginia has never cared about Federal employees or those in related industries -- always figured they would be there forever. Fat generals and admirals keep the contractors and installations in NOVA and Norfolk so they can stay there, and keep a job. Our AG is suing over Federal healthcare, global warming, and now he can add keeping wasteful government facilities open. Governor Bob will have to sale liquor stores, empty military bases and whatever. Take that hypocrites!  P.S. Thank you, Mr. Gates and President Obama....
I am afraid whatever the Democrats give to the people, the Republicans taketh away.

The current meltdown is a triumph for the GOP..during the Reagan years, conservatives used to boast that federal deficits would prevent the Govt from carrying out social programs ..suddenly every Republican is a deficit hawk.. Can anyone name the last Republican president to balance a budget?
Do they take a deduction for their dependents /children living abroad?
Well, that the stickler with Comprehensive Immigration Reform.  If you don't learnEnglish - you're gone - history.
It is about time! Defense budget is bloated too much. US should stop all wars and focus on reducing the budget deficit year after year and more importantly the huge national debt.

There is an easy way to cut the defense expenditures. Firs, let us get back to compulasory draft of every American, male or female, without any deferment or exception, except severe medical condition approved by government military doctors. This will bring the cost down two ways:

(1) the draftees will be paid minimum since they will be required to serve.
(2) There will be fewer military adventures such as war in Iraq. As I remember, the opposition to Vietnam war intensified not because of the TV reports on Vietnam but because Johnson decided to limit deferments for college students which led to protests on all campuses.

In addition, we will not have Rand Paul's spouting libertarian view that smart people should not fight where their lives would be in danger (as their chief preacher Ayn Rand suggested. Randy and the other fools on Wall Street else who have been pocketing bug bonus checks and resisting to pay their share in taxes with support from some equally selfish economists will be required to fight in other countries. No National guard loophole used by George Bush, pregnant wife loophole by Chaney or graduate student loophole by Clinton. This will bring all foreign adventures to a grinding halt. I do not expect Rush Limbaugh clamoring for fighting "his" enemies if he had to fight himself not using second amendment solution but under strict military discipline. So bring back the compulsory draft. No deferment.
Nope, I am not, I'm just an American citizen.

EJ - thanks so much for forwarding this article, it's great...gives a good perspective and enlightenment to other people's opinions. I understand the frustrations people have regarding providing healthcare to illegal immigrants, I guess I'm more into a fantasy idea where i wish medical care didn't involve money, it's a complex siuation for sure (sigh).

Gates is the consummate Washington game player performing the DC money shuffle nothing more.  Typical DC:  Big headlines, Big talk, Big numbers --- and Zero results.  As the DC elite gives the military 1% growth, these same people propose a freeze on Social Security, Medicare, and all social programs for three years. Thus, the question arises:  If Aunt Sally can’t afford to heat her house because she didn't get a COLA hike, why should we have to pay for our increasingly elite military’s golf courses, vacation resorts and other “fringe” benefits.  I say freeze them all.  What's good for one is good for all.

That the new crop of governors could potentially affect the drawing of districts so dramatically is outrageous. Indeed, that the drawing of 10-year districts should be so susceptible to the political conditions of one particular year of elections is outrageous.

Is there no way to draw districts in a non-partisan manner???

Comment # 5 is wishful thinking. Heaven forbid our Congress is taken over by the " gang that can't shoot straight ". They want to amend the Constitution, bring back Jim Crow by electing the Tea bagger candidates and their sacred mantra " tax cuts for the rich ".

House minority leader Boehner, is gearing up to become majority leader. If there isn't a golf game involved well.. We can only hope that the tone deaf right wing crazies get nowhere near a Congressional seat. After all isn't Congress a gov't job ? and we all know how much the GOP hates gov't. and the " gov't can't produce jobs " It's this kind of backwards hypocritical thinking that got our country into this mess in the first place. But just think.. if they repeal the 14th amendment, they all get to go back to the country of their ancestors and the Native Americans can get their land back. !! Go figure !!
You go Mr. Gates!  Let the rest of the cabinet follow. Thanks
